Module es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.corenlpentityextraction
Package es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.corenlpentityextraction

Class NamedEntityDictionaryHelper

java.lang.Object
es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.corenlpentityextraction.NamedEntityDictionaryHelper
final class NamedEntityDictionaryHelper
extends java.lang.Object
Contains helper methods for dealing with the contents of preexisting, internal use named entity dictionaries.
Author:
Alejandro González García

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.NamedEntityTerm
    Represents a named entity term, which can have synonyms.
    static class  NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.PropertyWithTemporaryFiles
    Holds the value for a property, and also provides a NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.PropertyWithTemporaryFiles.close() method to release temporary files created for this property.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.NamedEntityTerm>> namedEntitiesFromPathChildren​(@NonNull java.nio.file.Path rootPath)
    Walks through the specified root file system path and its children, searching for TSV files, and parses them as named entity dictionaries, adding the terms they contain to a map.
    static NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.PropertyWithTemporaryFiles namedEntitiesToSeedWordsFilesProperty​(@NonNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.NamedEntityTerm>> labelTerms)
    Converts the specified named entity map, as returned by namedEntitiesFromPathChildren(Path), to a seed words files property that can be passed to SPIED (GetPatternsFromDataMultiClass) for further processing.

  • Method Details

    • namedEntitiesFromPathChildren

      public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.NamedEntityTerm>> namedEntitiesFromPathChildren​(@NonNull @NonNull java.nio.file.Path rootPath) throws java.io.IOException
      Walks through the specified root file system path and its children, searching for TSV files, and parses them as named entity dictionaries, adding the terms they contain to a map. The entity type label for the terms in a file is the file name in upper case.
      Parameters:
      rootPath - The root path whose children files will be scanned for entities. Subdirectories will be ignored. Normally this path is a directory, but it can also be a regular file, in which case it will be the only file that is visited.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable map whose keys are the entity type labels which have at least a term, and the associated value is a set of terms for that label.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs during the operation.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If rootPath is null.

    • namedEntitiesToSeedWordsFilesProperty

      public static NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.PropertyWithTemporaryFiles namedEntitiesToSeedWordsFilesProperty​(@NonNull @NonNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Set<NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.NamedEntityTerm>> labelTerms) throws java.io.IOException
      Converts the specified named entity map, as returned by namedEntitiesFromPathChildren(Path), to a seed words files property that can be passed to SPIED (GetPatternsFromDataMultiClass) for further processing. The seed words files specified in the property will be created in the temporary directory reported by the operating system, and should be cleaned up when they are no longer necessary by calling NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.PropertyWithTemporaryFiles.close() explicitly or implicitly (for instance, in a try-with-resources block).
      Parameters:
      labelTerms - The map that associates named entity type labels with its terms, as returned by namedEntitiesFromPathChildren(Path).
      Returns:
      The property to pass to SPIED, whose value can be retrieved by calling es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.corenlpentityextraction.NamedEntityDictionaryHelper.PropertyWithTemporaryFiles#getValue().
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If some I/O error occurs during the operation.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If labelTerms is null.
